block.p: PHOENIX INVESTMENT PARTNERS LTD., Hartford, said it had accepted a $296 million offer from Phoenix Home Life Mutual Insurance Co., Hartford, to buy the shares in the asset manager that it did not already own.

SUNOCO INC., Philadelphia, said it planned to buy back as much as $200 million in stock, or about 8 percent of its common shares outstanding.

AEGON N.V., the Netherlands, said its Transamerica Finance Corporation unit, based in San Francisco, sold a $530 million consumer-loan portfolio to a U.S.-based affiliate of Goldman Sachs Group Inc., New York.
